programmes.show_description: Jungle Fantasy Land: Exploring the remains of a pioneering industry town in Ohio, a once beautiful Croatian resort bombarded by enemy fire, and an otherworldly garden of Eden in Mexico.
The Beached Leviathan: This episode features remains of a correctional facility in Atlanta, USA, forgotten remnants of fraud and fusion in Argentina and an ancient complex in Cambodia.
Vickers: The role played by engineering giant Vickers during the Second World War, including the development of the Spitfire and how the Royal Navy recovered from losing so many warships.
Shopping from Home.
Plymouth to New London: Michael Portillo heads for Plymouth, where he learns about the indigenous tribes of Wampanoag people.
New Haven to Plattsburgh: Michael Portillo's rail voyage continues through Connecticut heading north through the scenic New England states, where he takes a crash course in rowing.
Ford Zephyr/Autobianchi: Derek heads off to collect some vintage motorcycles from a garage at the bottom of the garden in the North-East of England.

Fiat Strada Abarth/Austin 10: Dave finds two rare Fiats and a VW Corrado. Derek has his work cut out trying to remove an old Morris that appears to be supporting the garage roof. What could possibly g
General Motors: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.
The Home Front: A fresh look at the Great War, with statistics helping to shed new light on the horrendous conflict. Hear about the effect of World War I on the domestic front.
Osborne House 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Osborne House on the Isle of Wight, where items brought to be valued include a globetrotting trunk and a Japanese jar found in a water tank.
Floors Castle 2: Fiona Bruce visits Floors Castle in Roxburghshire, where items include a piece of Robert Burns memorabilia and a figurine that is not quite what it seems.
Navy Ambo/Plas/Victor/Viscount/Lorry: Paul hits the road to collect an old navy ambulance that served its time as a holiday camper.
Manta/Berlinetta/TR7/BSA Bike: Dave travels to Bedale to extract a barn find - a 1984 Manta GTE which hasn't seen the light of day in thirty years.
General Motors: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.
The Home Front: A fresh look at the Great War, with statistics helping to shed new light on the horrendous conflict. Hear about the effect of World War I on the domestic front.
Osborne House 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Osborne House on the Isle of Wight, where items brought to be valued include a globetrotting trunk and a Japanese jar found in a water tank.
Simon's last leg begins on the remote Caribbean coast of Nicaragua before he encounters extreme violence on the mainland of Honduras and finishes his adventure on Jamaica.
Mexico / Riley Kestrel: A 1973 Ford Escort Mexico is the team's most expensive purchase to date. To save some cash Derek helps on their second buy - a 1968 Riley Kestrel.

Lotus Carlton Turbo/TR7 Special Edition: Derek's winging his way to Bingley to meet a kindred spirit who's parting with his TR7 after 32 years. Paul and Charlie head to Anglesey to collect a pair of L
Navy Ambo/Plas/Victor/Viscount/Lorry: Paul hits the road to collect an old navy ambulance that served its time as a holiday camper.
Manta/Berlinetta/TR7/BSA Bike: Dave travels to Bedale to extract a barn find - a 1984 Manta GTE which hasn't seen the light of day in thirty years.
Tunnel of Terrors: Exploring a military strong-hold in the Philippines, a facility that spawned an American sporting great, and an English relic that hosted a cinematic sensation.
Apocalyptic Skyscraper: Exploring a ruined castle above a German village, a rural town in Idaho, a futuristic skyscraper in Johannesburg and a fantasy world outside of Buenos Aires.
General Motors: How the Americans, once they were provoked into war, out-produced the rest of the world so quickly and by such a huge margin, including the likes of General Motors.
Shopping from Home.
Montreal to Ottawa: In Montreal, Michael Portillo learns how French and British colonial roots have influenced the city. In Ottawa, the former politician visits the country's parliament.
Thousand Islands to Toronto: Michael Portillo takes to the water for a nautical journey through the Thousand Islands, before his railway journey across Canada concludes in Toronto.
Ford Granada/Toyota Hilux: Derek navigates the dry stone walls of the Peak District to collect a very original 1988 Opel Manta. Plus, Dave deals with a Ford Granada rally support vehicle.
Bedford Bus/Triumph TR7: Derek has a three-hour drive in a 1960s bus that arrived in the UK after a life in the sun. Dave takes a Triumph TR7 convertible to auction.
US Aviation: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.
Total War: Learn more about the 'war to end all wars' through illuminating and often shocking statistics. After 1916, the imperial powers redoubled their efforts to win the war.
Cardiff Castle 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Cardiff Castle, where items brought in to be valued include a jug given as a love token, an early Hockney print, and a signed Elgar score.
Minehead Railway Station 2: Fiona Bruce presents from Minehead Railway Station, where items brought in include a chair thought to have once belonged to Henry VIII.
Rolls Royce/Impreza/Jag/Fords: There's Hollywood glamour in the air as Derek heads out to pick up a Rolls Royce that once belonged to Fred Astaire.
Healey/Porsche Soapbox: Austin Healeys are classic British vehicles that are difficult to tame. Paul and Charlie have the rare chance to pick up a trio of these iconic cars in varying conditions. S10
US Aviation: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.
Total War: Learn more about the 'war to end all wars' through illuminating and often shocking statistics. After 1916, the imperial powers redoubled their efforts to win the war.
Cardiff Castle 1: Fiona Bruce presents from Cardiff Castle, where items brought in to be valued include a jug given as a love token, an early Hockney print, and a signed Elgar score.
Simon begins his journey in the south of Ireland by paramotoring with an Irish explorer before doing a spot of surfing and climbing Croagh Patrick in honour of Ireland's patron saint.
Daimler / Triumph 2000: Derek points the team towards one of his favourite motors - a 1983 Daimler Double Six. And a Triumph 2000 is given a modern day makeover under the bonnet.
Porsche 911: Irv imports an original-run short wheelbase Porsche 911 from the east coast of America. He needs to make it roadworthy, while keeping its incredible sun-faded patina.
Rolls Royce/Impreza/Jag/Fords: There's Hollywood glamour in the air as Derek heads out to pick up a Rolls Royce that once belonged to Fred Astaire.
Healey/Porsche Soapbox: Austin Healeys are classic British vehicles that are difficult to tame. Paul and Charlie have the rare chance to pick up a trio of these iconic cars in varying conditions. S10
